summary: An internal FBI email from August 6, 2019, discussing tentative plans for the FBI to execute a search warrant at Jeffrey Epstein's private island off St. Thomas. The email coordinates travel and availability for the operation, which was expected to take 1-3 days.

persons.name: SSA MI Squad C-20
persons.context: The sender of the initial email coordinating the search warrant operation for Epstein's island, representing the Crimes Against Children/Human Trafficking squad.

events.title: Planned FBI travel to Epstein's island
events.description: The FBI team planned to fly out on the FBI Q400 plane to St. Thomas to execute a search warrant on Epstein's private island.

events.title: Planned return travel from search operation
events.description: The tentative date for the FBI team to return home after completing the 1-3 day search of Epstein's island.

keyFacts: The Southern District of New York (SDNY) was drafting a search warrant affidavit for Jeffrey Epstein's private island near St. Thomas as of August 6, 2019.
The FBI planned to execute the search warrant on or after August 11, 2019, using an FBI Q400 aircraft for travel.
The search operation was expected to last 1-3 days and be managed by the FBI's Evidence Response Team (ERT).
The email demonstrates active, high-level FBI planning for a significant investigative action against Epstein's assets shortly before his death in August 2019.
The correspondence highlights coordination between the SDNY and the FBI's Crimes Against Children/Human Trafficking squad.
